H0.text: Lymph capillaries collect fluid that leaks out from blood capillaries.

H1.text: Pulmonary capillaries collect fluid that leaks out from blood capillaries.

H2.text: Varicose veins are structures that collect fluid that leaks out from blood capillaries.

H3.text: Alveoli collect fluid that leaks out from blood capillaries.

A4.text: Lymph capillaries are dispersed among the blood-related capillaries providing efficient and effective uptake from the interstitial fluid during capillary exchange.

A5.text: When pressure is greater in the interstitial fluid than in lymph, the cells separate slightly, like the opening of a one-way swinging door, and interstitial fluid enters the lymphatic capillary.
